errorCategory.title: Region references
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The used region must refer to an existing
                region.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
The region attribute refers to a region element which defines the
                space in terms of origin and extent, within which the text of a subtitle is
                displayed.

specs.name: Timed Text Markup Language 1 (TTML1) (Second Edition), Version 2013-09-24
specs.text:
If specified, the value of a region attribute must adhere to the IDREF
                    data type [...], and, furthermore, this IDREF must reference a region element
                    which has a layout element as an ancestor.

specs.name: Timed Text Markup Language 2 (TTML2) CR, Version 2018-03-13
specs.text:
If specified, the value of a region attribute must adhere to the IDREF
                    data type [...], and, furthermore, this IDREF must reference a region element
                    which has a layout element as an ancestor.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or attribute
                value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is prohibited in the
                profile.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text
                Profile Constraints.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1), Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted or optional in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or
                attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is
                prohibited in the profile.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text
                Profile Constraints.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1, Version 2017-10-17
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted or optional in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or
                attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is
                prohibited in the profile.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1 - Text Profile, Version 2017-10-17
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Supported Features and Extensions, 7.
                Common Provisions and 8. Text Profile Provisions.

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text:
Subtitle and SDH files for all languages must be delivered in a TTML (.dfxp or
                .xml) format, except for Japanese, which must be delivered in Videotron Lambda Cap
                format.

messages.messageMain:
Assertion: The region attribute refers to an existing region.
                Error Information: The value of the attribute 'region' is 'bottomAlignd'.
messages.messageAssertion: The region attribute refers to an existing region.
messages.messageDiagnosticsAll: The value of the attribute 'region' is 'bottomAlignd'.

locations.preview:
<tt:p begin="00:00:51.400" end="00:00:55.360" style="textAlignCenter" region="bottomAlignd" xml:id="sub13">
            <tt:span style="WhiteOnBlack doubleHeight">I should just crush you.</tt:span>
         </tt:p>

errorCategory.title: Text Profile signalling
errorCategory.shortUserDesc: The IMSC1 profile should be signalled.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
The used IMSC1 profile should be signalled to indicate the
                specification conformance of a document. This eases possible further
                processing.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
The ttp:profile attribute SHOULD be present on the tt element and equal to
                    the designator of the IMSC1 profile to which the Document Instance conforms, and
                    the ttp:profile element SHOULD NOT be present, unless: the Document Instance
                    also conforms to EBU-TT-D, in which case the ttp:profile attribute and the
                    ttp:profile element SHOULD NOT be present, and instead the designator of the
                    IMSC1 profile to which the Document Instance conforms and the URI
                    "urn:ebu:tt:distribution:2014-01" SHOULD each be carried in an
                    ebuttm:conformsToStandard element as specified in EBU-TT-D; or the Document
                    Instance also conforms to ttml10-sdp-us, in which case the ttp:profile attribute
                    SHOULD NOT be present. ttml10-sdp-us requires that the ttp:profile element be
                    present and that its use attribute be set to a specified value.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
The ttp:profile attribute SHOULD be present on the tt element and equal to
                    the designator of the IMSC1 profile to which the Document Instance conforms, and
                    the ttp:profile element SHOULD NOT be present, unless: the Document Instance
                    also conforms to EBU-TT-D, in which case neither the ttp:profile attribute nor
                    the ttp:profile element are present, and, instead the designator of the IMSC1
                    profile to which the Document Instance conforms and the URI
                    "urn:ebu:tt:distribution:2014-01" SHOULD each be carried in an
                    ebuttm:conformsToStandard element as specified in EBU-TT-D and illustrated in
                    I.2 EBU-TT-D; or the Document Instance also conforms to ttml10-sdp-us, in which
                    case the ttp:profile attribute is not present and the ttp:profile element is
                    present, as illustrated in I.3 SDP-US.

messages.messageMain: Assertion: The IMSC1 Text profile should be signalled.
messages.messageAssertion: The IMSC1 Text profile should be signalled.

errorCategory.title: ebutts:multiRowAlign value
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The value of the ebutts:multiRowAlign attribute must conform to
                the defined syntax.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
The ebutts:multiRowAlign attribute refers to the case that more
                than one text line is present in a subtitle. It defines the alignment of the
                subtitles in relation to the specific text line which is rendered with the highest
                width compared to the other lines. Usually this value corresponds to the value of
                the more general tts:textAlign attribute or is just set to centered multi row
                alignment. The allowed values are defined by an enumeration.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1), Version 2017-07-13
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1, Version 2017-10-17

TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text
                Profile Constraints.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text
                Profile Constraints.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1 - Text Profile, Version 2017-10-17
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Supported Features and Extensions, 7.
                Common Provisions and 8. Text Profile Provisions.

messages.messageMain:
Assertion: The ebutts:multiRowAlign attribute has one of the following values: 'start', 'center', 'end', 'auto'
                Error Information: The value of the attribute 'ebutts:multiRowAlign' is 'begin'.
messages.messageAssertion: The ebutts:multiRowAlign attribute has one of the following values: 'start', 'center', 'end', 'auto'
messages.messageDiagnosticsAll: The value of the attribute 'ebutts:multiRowAlign' is 'begin'.

locations.preview: <tt:region xml:id="bottomAligned" tts:extent="80% 80%" tts:origin="10% 10%" tts:padding="0%" tts:displayAlign="after" tts:writingMode="lrtb" ebutts:multiRowAlign="begin"/>

errorCategory.title: tts:displayAlign usage
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The tts:displayAlign attribute must be used for vertical alignment
                of subtitles.

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text:
Use tts:textAlign and tts:displayAlign for positioning along with static
                    values for tts:extent and tts:origin.

messages.messageMain: Assertion: The tts:displayAlign attribute is used for vertical alignment of subtitles.
messages.messageAssertion: The tts:displayAlign attribute is used for vertical alignment of subtitles.

            <tt:span style="WhiteOnBlack doubleHeight">I should just crush you.</tt:span>
         </tt:p>

errorCategory.title: tts:origin usage
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The tts:origin attribute must be used for subtitle
                positioning.

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text:
Use tts:textAlign and tts:displayAlign for positioning along with static
                    values for tts:extent and tts:origin.

messages.messageMain: Assertion: The tts:origin attribute is used for subtitle positioning.
messages.messageAssertion: The tts:origin attribute is used for subtitle positioning.

errorCategory.title: ttp:frameRate present
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
It is recommended that the ttp:frameRate attribute is present on
                the tt:tt element, as it is required to check the Netflix frame gap
                constraint.

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text: 2 frames minimum (regardless of frame rate)

messages.messageMain: Assertion: The ttp:frameRate attribute is present on the tt:tt element.
messages.messageAssertion: The ttp:frameRate attribute is present on the tt:tt element.
